member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BlockPublicAccess
member.summary: Provides information about the block public access settings for an S3 bucket. These settings can apply to a bucket at the account level or bucket level. For detailed information about each setting, see Blocking public access to your Amazon S3 storage in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BlockPublicAccess.BlockPublicAcls
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockPublicAcls.
Specifies whether Amazon S3 blocks public access control lists (ACLs) for the bucket and objects in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BlockPublicAccess.BlockPublicPolicy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockPublicPolicy.
Specifies whether Amazon S3 blocks public bucket policies for the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BlockPublicAccess.IgnorePublicAcls
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IgnorePublicAcls.
Specifies whether Amazon S3 ignores public ACLs for the bucket and objects in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BlockPublicAccess.RestrictPublicBuckets
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property RestrictPublicBuckets.
Specifies whether Amazon S3 restricts public bucket policies for the bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountByEffectivePermission
member.summary: Provides information about the number of S3 buckets that are publicly accessible based on a combination of permissions settings for each bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountByEffectivePermission.PubliclyAccessible
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PubliclyAccessible.
The total number of buckets that allow the general public to have read or write access to the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountByEffectivePermission.PubliclyReadable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PubliclyReadable.
The total number of buckets that allow the general public to have read access to the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountByEffectivePermission.PubliclyWritable
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PubliclyWritable.
The total number of buckets that allow the general public to have write access to the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountByEffectivePermission.Unknown
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Unknown.
The total number of buckets that Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate permissions settings for. Macie can't determine whether these buckets are publicly accessible.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountByEncryptionType
member.summary: Provides information about the number of S3 buckets that use certain types of server-side encryption by default or don't encrypt new objects by default. For detailed information about these settings, see Setting default server-side encryption behavior for Amazon S3 buckets in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountByEncryptionType.KmsManaged
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsManaged.
The total number of buckets that use an KMS key to encrypt new objects by default, either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a customer managed key. These buckets use KMS encryption (SSE-KMS) by default.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountByEncryptionType.S3Managed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Managed.
The total number of buckets that use an Amazon S3 managed key to encrypt new objects by default. These buckets use Amazon S3 managed encryption (SSE-S3) by default.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountByEncryptionType.Unencrypted
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Unencrypted.
The total number of buckets that don't encrypt new objects by default. Default encryption is disabled for these buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountByEncryptionType.Unknown
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Unknown.
The total number of buckets that Amazon Macie doesn't have current encryption metadata for. Macie can't provide current data about the default encryption settings for these buckets.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountBySharedAccessType
member.summary: Provides information about the number of S3 buckets that are or aren't shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountBySharedAccessType.External
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property External.
The total number of buckets that are shared with an Amazon Web Services account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountBySharedAccessType.Internal
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Internal.
The total number of buckets that are shared with an Amazon Web Services account that's part of the same Amazon Macie organization.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountBySharedAccessType.NotShared
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property NotShared.
The total number of buckets that aren't shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountBySharedAccessType.Unknown
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Unknown.
The total number of buckets that Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate shared access settings for. Macie can't determine whether these buckets are shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads
member.summary: Provides information about the number of S3 buckets whose bucket policies do or don't require server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads.AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads.
The total number of buckets that don't have a bucket policy or have a bucket policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If a bucket policy exists, the policy doesn't require PutObject requests to include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads.DeniesUnencryptedObjectUploads
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DeniesUnencryptedObjectUploads.
The total number of buckets whose bucket policies require server-side encryption of new objects. PutObject requests for these buckets must include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must be AES256 or aws:kms.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCountPolicyAllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads.Unknown
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Unknown.
The total number of buckets that Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate server-side encryption requirements for. Macie can't determine whether the bucket policies for these buckets require server-side encryption of new objects.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties
member.summary: Specifies the operator to use in a property-based condition that filters the results of a query for information about S3 buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties.Eq
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Eq.
The value for the property matches (equals) the specified value. If you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties.Gt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Gt.
The value for the property is greater than the specified value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties.Gte
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Gte.
The value for the property is greater than or equal to the specified value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties.Lt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lt.
The value for the property is less than the specified value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties.Lte
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Lte.
The value for the property is less than or equal to the specified value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties.Neq
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Neq.
The value for the property doesn't match (doesn't equal) the specified value. If you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses OR logic to join the values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketCriteriaAdditionalProperties.Prefix
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Prefix.
The name of the bucket begins with the specified value.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketLevelPermissions
member.summary: Provides information about the bucket-level permissions settings for an S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketLevelPermissions.AccessControlList
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccessControlList.
The permissions settings of the access control list (ACL) for the bucket. This value is null if an ACL hasn't been defined for the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketLevelPermissions.BlockPublicAccess
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BlockPublicAccess.
The block public access settings for the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketLevelPermissions.BucketPolicy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketPolicy.
The permissions settings of the bucket policy for the bucket. This value is null if a bucket policy hasn't been defined for the bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata
member.summary: Provides statistical data and other information about an S3 bucket that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes for your account. If an error occurs when Macie attempts to retrieve and process information about the bucket or the bucket's objects, the value for most of these properties is null. Exceptions are accountId, bucketArn, bucketCreatedAt, bucketName, lastUpdated, and region. To identify the cause of the error, refer to the errorCode and errorMessage values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account that owns the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowsUnencryptedObjectUploads.
Specifies whether the bucket policy for the bucket requires server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the bucket. Possible values are:
FALSE - The bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new objects. PutObject requests must include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and the value for that header must be AES256 or aws:kms.
TRUE - The bucket doesn't have a bucket policy or it has a bucket policy that doesn't require server-side encryption of new objects. If a bucket policy exists, it doesn't require PutObject requests to include the x-amz-server-side-encryption header and it doesn't require the value for that header to be AES256 or aws:kms.
UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket policy requires server-side encryption of new objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.BucketArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.BucketCreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketCreatedAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the bucket was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.BucketName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketName.
The name of the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.ClassifiableObjectCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClassifiableObjectCount.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.ClassifiableSizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClassifiableSizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the bucket. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.ErrorCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorCode.
Specifies the error code for an error that prevented Amazon Macie from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the bucket's objects. If this value is ACCESS_DENIED, Macie doesn't have permission to retrieve the information. For example, the bucket has a restrictive bucket policy and Amazon S3 denied the request. If this value is null, Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.ErrorMessage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ErrorMessage.
A brief description of the error (errorCode) that prevented Amazon Macie from retrieving and processing information about the bucket and the bucket's objects. This value is null if Macie was able to retrieve and process the information.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.JobDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobDetails.
Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are configured to analyze data in the bucket, and, if so, the details of the job that ran most recently.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.LastUpdated
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastUpdated.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Macie most recently retrieved both bucket and object metadata from Amazon S3 for the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.ObjectCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ObjectCount.
The total number of objects in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.ObjectCountByEncryptionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ObjectCountByEncryptionType.
The total number of objects that are in the bucket, grouped by server-side encryption type. This includes a grouping that reports the total number of objects that aren't encrypted or use client-side encryption.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.PublicAccess
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PublicAccess.
Specifies whether the bucket is publicly accessible due to the combination of permissions settings that apply to the bucket, and provides information about those settings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.Region
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Region.
The Amazon Web Services Region that hosts the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.ReplicationDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ReplicationDetails.
Specifies whether the bucket is configured to replicate one or more objects to buckets for other Amazon Web Services accounts and, if so, which accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.ServerSideEncryption
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ServerSideEncryption.
Specifies whether the bucket encrypts new objects by default and, if so, the type of server-side encryption that's used.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.SharedAccess
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SharedAccess.
Specifies whether the bucket is shared with another Amazon Web Services account. Possible values are:
EXTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services account that isn't part of the same Amazon Macie organization.
INTERNAL - The bucket is shared with an Amazon Web Services account that's part of the same Amazon Macie organization.
NOT_SHARED - The bucket isn't shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts.
UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie wasn't able to evaluate the shared access settings for the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.SizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the bucket.
If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of each object in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.SizeInBytesCompressed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SizeInBytesCompressed.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that are compressed (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files in the bucket.
If versioning is enabled for the bucket, Amazon Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in the bucket. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of each applicable object in the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
An array that specifies the tags (keys and values) that are associated with the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.UnclassifiableObjectCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnclassifiableObjectCount.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.UnclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the bucket. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketMetadata.Versioning
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Versioning.
Specifies whether versioning is enabled for the bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketPermissionConfiguration
member.summary: Provides information about the account-level and bucket-level permissions settings for an S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketPermissionConfiguration.AccountLevelPermissions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountLevelPermissions.
The account-level permissions settings that apply to the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketPermissionConfiguration.BucketLevelPermissions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketLevelPermissions.
The bucket-level permissions settings for the bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketPolicy
member.summary: Provides information about the permissions settings of the bucket policy for an S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketPolicy.AllowsPublicReadAccess
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowsPublicReadAccess.
Specifies whether the bucket policy allows the general public to have read access to the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketPolicy.AllowsPublicWriteAccess
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AllowsPublicWriteAccess.
Specifies whether the bucket policy allows the general public to have write access to the bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketPublicAccess
member.summary: Provides information about the permissions settings that determine whether an S3 bucket is publicly accessible.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketPublicAccess.EffectivePermission
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EffectivePermission.
Specifies whether the bucket is publicly accessible due to the combination of permissions settings that apply to the bucket. Possible values are:
NOT_PUBLIC - The bucket isn't publicly accessible.
PUBLIC - The bucket is publicly accessible.
UNKNOWN - Amazon Macie can't determine whether the bucket is publicly accessible.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketPublicAccess.PermissionConfiguration
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PermissionConfiguration.
The account-level and bucket-level permissions settings for the bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketServerSideEncryption
member.summary: Provides information about the default server-side encryption settings for an S3 bucket. For detailed information about these settings, see Setting default server-side encryption behavior for Amazon S3 buckets in the Amazon Simple Storage Service User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketServerSideEncryption.KmsMasterKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsMasterKeyId.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) or unique identifier (key ID) for the KMS key that's used by default to encrypt objects that are added to the bucket. This value is null if the bucket uses an Amazon S3 managed key to encrypt new objects or the bucket doesn't encrypt new objects by default.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketServerSideEncryption.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of server-side encryption that's used by default when storing new objects in the bucket. Possible values are:
AES256 - New objects are encrypted with an Amazon S3 managed key. They use SSE-S3 encryption.
aws:kms - New objects are encrypted with an KMS key (kmsMasterKeyId), either an Amazon Web Services managed key or a customer managed key. They use SSE-KMS encryption.
NONE - New objects aren't encrypted by default. Default encryption is disabled for the bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketSortCriteria
member.summary: Specifies criteria for sorting the results of a query for information about S3 buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketSortCriteria.AttributeName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AttributeName.
The name of the bucket property to sort the results by. This value can be one of the following properties that Amazon Macie defines as bucket metadata: accountId, bucketName, classifiableObjectCount, classifiableSizeInBytes, objectCount, or sizeInBytes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.BucketSortCriteria.OrderBy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OrderBy.
The sort order to apply to the results, based on the value specified by the attributeName property. Valid values are: ASC, sort the results in ascending order; and, DESC, sort the results in descending order.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Cell
member.summary: Specifies the location of an occurrence of sensitive data in a Microsoft Excel workbook, CSV file, or TSV file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Cell.CellReference
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CellReference.
The location of the cell, as an absolute cell reference, that contains the sensitive data, for example Sheet2!C5 for cell C5 on Sheet2 in a Microsoft Excel workbook. This value is null for CSV and TSV files.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Cell.Column
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Column.
The column number of the column that contains the sensitive data. For a Microsoft Excel workbook, this value correlates to the alphabetical character(s) for a column identifier, for example: 1 for column A, 2 for column B, and so on.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Cell.ColumnName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ColumnName.
The name of the column that contains the sensitive data, if available.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Cell.Row
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Row.
The row number of the row that contains the sensitive data.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationDetails
member.summary: Provides information about a sensitive data finding, including the classification job that produced the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationDetails.DetailedResultsLocation
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DetailedResultsLocation.
The path to the folder or file (in Amazon S3) that contains the corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the finding. If a finding applies to a large archive or compressed file, this value is the path to a folder. Otherwise, this value is the path to a file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationDetails.JobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the classification job that produced the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationDetails.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier for the classification job that produced the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationDetails.Result
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Result.
The status and other details of the finding.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationExportConfiguration
member.summary: Specifies where to store data classification results, and the encryption settings to use when storing results in that location. Currently, you can store classification results only in an S3 bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationExportConfiguration.S3Destination
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Destination.
The S3 bucket to store data classification results in, and the encryption settings to use when storing results in that bucket.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationResult
member.summary: Provides the details of a sensitive data finding, including the types, number of occurrences, and locations of the sensitive data that was detected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationResult.AdditionalOccurrences
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AdditionalOccurrences.
Specifies whether Amazon Macie detected additional occurrences of sensitive data in the S3 object. A finding includes location data for a maximum of 15 occurrences of sensitive data.
This value can help you determine whether to investigate additional occurrences of sensitive data in an object. You can do this by referring to the corresponding sensitive data discovery result for the finding (ClassificationDetails.detailedResultsLocation).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationResult.CustomDataIdentifiers
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomDataIdentifiers.
The custom data identifiers that detected the sensitive data and the number of occurrences of the data that they detected.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationResult.MimeType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MimeType.
The type of content, as a MIME type, that the finding applies to. For example, application/gzip, for a GNU Gzip compressed archive file, or application/pdf, for an Adobe Portable Document Format file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationResult.SensitiveData
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SensitiveData.
The category, types, and number of occurrences of the sensitive data that produced the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationResult.SizeClassified
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SizeClassified.
The total size, in bytes, of the data that the finding applies to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationResult.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the finding.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationResultStatus
member.summary: Provides information about the status of a sensitive data finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationResultStatus.Code
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Code.
The status of the finding. Possible values are:
COMPLETE - Amazon Macie successfully completed its analysis of the S3 object that the finding applies to.
PARTIAL - Macie analyzed only a subset of the data in the S3 object that the finding applies to. For example, the object is an archive file that contains files in an unsupported format.
SKIPPED - Macie wasn't able to analyze the S3 object that the finding applies to. For example, the object is a file in an unsupported format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.ClassificationResultStatus.Reason
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Reason.
A brief description of the status of the finding. Amazon Macie uses this value to notify you of any errors, warnings, or considerations that might impact your analysis of the finding.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateClassificationJob operation. Creates and defines the settings for a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A unique, case-sensitive token that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.CustomDataIdentifierIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomDataIdentifierIds.
An array of unique identifiers, one for each custom data identifier for the job to use when it analyzes data. To use only managed data identifiers, don't specify a value for this property and specify a value other than NONE for the managedDataIdentifierSelector property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A custom description of the job. The description can contain as many as 200 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.InitialRun
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InitialRun.
For a recurring job, specifies whether to analyze all existing, eligible objects immediately after the job is created (true). To analyze only those objects that are created or changed after you create the job and before the job's first scheduled run, set this value to false.
If you configure the job to run only once, don't specify a value for this property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.JobType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobType.
The schedule for running the job. Valid values are:
ONE_TIME - Run the job only once. If you specify this value, don't specify a value for the scheduleFrequency property.
SCHEDULED - Run the job on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis. If you specify this value, use the scheduleFrequency property to define the recurrence pattern for the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.ManagedDataIdentifierIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManagedDataIdentifierIds.
An array of unique identifiers, one for each managed data identifier for the job to include (use) or exclude (not use) when it analyzes data. Inclusion or exclusion depends on the managed data identifier selection type that you specify for the job (managedDataIdentifierSelector).
To retrieve a list of valid values for this property, use the ListManagedDataIdentifiers operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.ManagedDataIdentifierSelector
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManagedDataIdentifierSelector.
The selection type to apply when determining which managed data identifiers the job uses to analyze data. Valid values are:
ALL - Use all the managed data identifiers that Amazon Macie provides. If you specify this value, don't specify any values for the managedDataIdentifierIds property.
EXCLUDE - Use all the managed data identifiers that Macie provides except the managed data identifiers specified by the managedDataIdentifierIds property.
INCLUDE - Use only the managed data identifiers specified by the managedDataIdentifierIds property.
NONE - Don't use any managed data identifiers. If you specify this value, specify at least one custom data identifier for the job (customDataIdentifierIds) and don't specify any values for the managedDataIdentifierIds property.
If you don't specify a value for this property, the job uses all managed data identifiers. If you don't specify a value for this property or you specify ALL or EXCLUDE for a recurring job, the job also uses new managed data identifiers as they are released.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
A custom name for the job. The name can contain as many as 500 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.S3JobDefinition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3JobDefinition.
The S3 buckets that contain the objects to analyze, and the scope of that analysis.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.SamplingPercentage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SamplingPercentage.
The sampling depth, as a percentage, for the job to apply when processing objects. This value determines the percentage of eligible objects that the job analyzes. If this value is less than 100, Amazon Macie selects the objects to analyze at random, up to the specified percentage, and analyzes all the data in those objects.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.ScheduleFrequency
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleFrequency.
The recurrence pattern for running the job. To run the job only once, don't specify a value for this property and set the value for the jobType property to ONE_TIME.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A map of key-value pairs that specifies the tags to associate with the job.
A job can have a maximum of 50 tags. Each tag consists of a tag key and an associated tag value. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateClassificationJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobResponse.JobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateClassificationJobResponse.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier for the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateCustomDataIdentifier operation. Creates and defines the criteria and other settings for a custom data identifier.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A unique, case-sensitive token that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A custom description of the custom data identifier. The description can contain as many as 512 characters.
We strongly recommend that you avoid including any sensitive data in the description of a custom data identifier. Other users of your account might be able to see the identifier's description, depending on the actions that they're allowed to perform in Amazon Macie.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierRequest.IgnoreWords
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IgnoreWords.
An array that lists specific character sequences (ignore words) to exclude from the results. If the text matched by the regular expression is the same as any string in this array, Amazon Macie ignores it. The array can contain as many as 10 ignore words. Each ignore word can contain 4-90 UTF-8 characters. Ignore words are case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierRequest.Keywords
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Keywords.
An array that lists specific character sequences (keywords), one of which must be within proximity (maximumMatchDistance) of the regular expression to match. The array can contain as many as 50 keywords. Each keyword can contain 3-90 UTF-8 characters. Keywords aren't case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierRequest.MaximumMatchDistance
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaximumMatchDistance.
The maximum number of characters that can exist between text that matches the regex pattern and the character sequences specified by the keywords array. Amazon Macie includes or excludes a result based on the proximity of a keyword to text that matches the regex pattern. The distance can be 1-300 characters. The default value is 50.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
A custom name for the custom data identifier. The name can contain as many as 128 characters.
We strongly recommend that you avoid including any sensitive data in the name of a custom data identifier. Other users of your account might be able to see the identifier's name, depending on the actions that they're allowed to perform in Amazon Macie.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierRequest.Regex
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Regex.
The regular expression (regex) that defines the pattern to match. The expression can contain as many as 512 characters.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A map of key-value pairs that specifies the tags to associate with the custom data identifier.
A custom data identifier can have a maximum of 50 tags. Each tag consists of a tag key and an associated tag value. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateCustomDataIdentifier operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateCustomDataIdentifierResponse.CustomDataIdentifierId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomDataIdentifierId.
The unique identifier for the custom data identifier that was created.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateFindingsFilter operation. Creates and defines the criteria and other settings for a findings filter.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterRequest.Action
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Action.
The action to perform on findings that meet the filter criteria (findingCriteria). Valid values are: ARCHIVE, suppress (automatically archive) the findings; and, NOOP, don't perform any action on the findings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A unique, case-sensitive token that you provide to ensure the idempotency of the request.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
A custom description of the filter. The description can contain as many as 512 characters.
We strongly recommend that you avoid including any sensitive data in the description of a filter. Other users of your account might be able to see the filter's description, depending on the actions that they're allowed to perform in Amazon Macie.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterRequest.FindingCriteria
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FindingCriteria.
The criteria to use to filter findings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
A custom name for the filter. The name must contain at least 3 characters and can contain as many as 64 characters.
We strongly recommend that you avoid including any sensitive data in the name of a filter. Other users of your account might be able to see the filter's name, depending on the actions that they're allowed to perform in Amazon Macie.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterRequest.Position
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Position.
The position of the filter in the list of saved filters on the Amazon Macie console. This value also determines the order in which the filter is applied to findings, relative to other filters that are also applied to the findings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A map of key-value pairs that specifies the tags to associate with the filter.
A findings filter can have a maximum of 50 tags. Each tag consists of a tag key and an associated tag value. The maximum length of a tag key is 128 characters. The maximum length of a tag value is 256 characters.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateFindingsFilter operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterResponse.Arn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Arn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the filter that was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateFindingsFilterResponse.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the filter that was created.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateInvitationsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateInvitations operation. Sends an Amazon Macie membership invitation to one or more accounts.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateInvitationsRequest.AccountIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountIds.
An array that lists Amazon Web Services account IDs, one for each account to send the invitation to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateInvitationsRequest.DisableEmailNotification
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DisableEmailNotification.
Specifies whether to send an email notification to the root user of each account that the invitation will be sent to. This notification is in addition to an alert that the root user receives in Personal Health Dashboard. To send an email notification to the root user of each account, set this value to true.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateInvitationsRequest.Message
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Message.
A custom message to include in the invitation. Amazon Macie adds this message to the standard content that it sends for an invitation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateInvitationsResponse

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateInvitationsResponse.UnprocessedAccounts
member.summary:

An array of objects, one for each account whose invitation hasn't been processed. Each object identifies the account and explains why the invitation hasn't been processed for the account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateMemberRequest.Account
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateMemberRequest.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A map of key-value pairs that specifies the tags to associate with the account in Amazon Macie.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateMemberResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateMember operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateMemberResponse.Arn

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateSampleFindingsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateSampleFindings operation. Creates sample findings.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateSampleFindingsRequest.FindingTypes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property FindingTypes.
An array that lists one or more types of findings to include in the set of sample findings. Currently, the only supported value is Policy:IAMUser/S3BucketEncryptionDisabled.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CreateSampleFindingsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the CreateSampleFindings operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CriteriaBlockForJob
member.summary: Specifies one or more property- and tag-based conditions that define criteria for including or excluding S3 buckets from a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CriteriaBlockForJob.And
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property And.
An array of conditions, one for each condition that determines which buckets to include or exclude from the job. If you specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join the conditions.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CriteriaForJob
member.summary: Specifies a property- or tag-based condition that defines criteria for including or excluding S3 buckets from a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CriteriaForJob.SimpleCriterion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SimpleCriterion.
A property-based condition that defines a property, operator, and one or more values for including or excluding buckets from the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CriteriaForJob.TagCriterion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagCriterion.
A tag-based condition that defines an operator and tag keys, tag values, or tag key and value pairs for including or excluding buckets from the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CriterionAdditionalProperties
member.summary: Specifies the operator to use in a property-based condition that filters the results of a query for findings. For detailed information and examples of each operator, see Fundamentals of filtering findings in the Amazon Macie User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CriterionAdditionalProperties.Eq
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Eq.
The value for the property matches (equals) the specified value. If you specify multiple values, Macie uses OR logic to join the values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.CriterionAdditionalProperties.EqExactMatch
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EqExactMatch.
The value for the property exclusively matches (equals an exact match for) all the specified values. If you specify multiple values, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join the values.
You can use this operator with the following properties: customDataIdentifiers.detections.arn, customDataIdentifiers.detections.name, resourcesAffected.s3Bucket.tags.key, resourcesAffected.s3Bucket.tags.value, resourcesAffected.s3Object.tags.key, resourcesAffected.s3Object.tags.value, sensitiveData.category, and sensitiveData.detections.type.

member.summary: Container for the parameters to the DescribeClassificationJob operation. Retrieves the status and settings for a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier for the classification job.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the DescribeClassificationJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
The token that was provided to ensure the idempotency of the request to create the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.CustomDataIdentifierIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CustomDataIdentifierIds.
An array of unique identifiers, one for each custom data identifier that the job uses to analyze data. This value is null if the job uses only managed data identifiers to analyze data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The custom description of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.InitialRun
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InitialRun.
For a recurring job, specifies whether you configured the job to analyze all existing, eligible objects immediately after the job was created (true). If you configured the job to analyze only those objects that were created or changed after the job was created and before the job's first scheduled run, this value is false. This value is also false for a one-time job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.JobArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier for the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The current status of the job. Possible values are:
CANCELLED - You cancelled the job or, if it's a one-time job, you paused the job and didn't resume it within 30 days.
COMPLETE - For a one-time job, Amazon Macie finished processing the data specified for the job. This value doesn't apply to recurring jobs.
IDLE - For a recurring job, the previous scheduled run is complete and the next scheduled run is pending. This value doesn't apply to one-time jobs.
PAUSED - Macie started running the job but additional processing would exceed the monthly sensitive data discovery quota for your account or one or more member accounts that the job analyzes data for.
RUNNING - For a one-time job, the job is in progress. For a recurring job, a scheduled run is in progress.
USER_PAUSED - You paused the job. If you paused the job while it had a status of RUNNING and you don't resume it within 30 days of pausing it, the job or job run will expire and be cancelled, depending on the job's type. To check the expiration date, refer to the UserPausedDetails.jobExpiresAt property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.JobType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobType.
The schedule for running the job. Possible values are:
ONE_TIME - The job runs only once.
SCHEDULED - The job runs on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis. The scheduleFrequency property indicates the recurrence pattern for the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.LastRunErrorStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastRunErrorStatus.
Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred when the job ran. For a recurring job, this value indicates the error status of the job's most recent run.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.LastRunTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastRunTime.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job started. If the job is a recurring job, this value indicates when the most recent run started.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.ManagedDataIdentifierIds
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManagedDataIdentifierIds.
An array of unique identifiers, one for each managed data identifier that the job is explicitly configured to include (use) or exclude (not use) when it analyzes data. Inclusion or exclusion depends on the managed data identifier selection type specified for the job (managedDataIdentifierSelector). This value is null if the job's managed data identifier selection type is ALL or the job uses only custom data identifiers (customDataIdentifierIds) to analyze data.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.ManagedDataIdentifierSelector
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ManagedDataIdentifierSelector.
The selection type that determines which managed data identifiers the job uses to analyze data. Possible values are:
ALL - Use all the managed data identifiers that Amazon Macie provides.
EXCLUDE - Use all the managed data identifiers that Macie provides except the managed data identifiers specified by the managedDataIdentifierIds property.
INCLUDE - Use only the managed data identifiers specified by the managedDataIdentifierIds property.
NONE - Don't use any managed data identifiers.
If this value is null, the job uses all managed data identifiers. If this value is null, ALL, or EXCLUDE for a recurring job, the job also uses new managed data identifiers as they are released.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The custom name of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.S3JobDefinition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3JobDefinition.
The S3 buckets that contain the objects to analyze, and the scope of that analysis.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.SamplingPercentage
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SamplingPercentage.
The sampling depth, as a percentage, that determines the percentage of eligible objects that the job analyzes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.ScheduleFrequency
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ScheduleFrequency.
The recurrence pattern for running the job. This value is null if the job is configured to run only once.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.Statistics
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Statistics.
The number of times that the job has run and processing statistics for the job's current run.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.Tags
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Tags.
A map of key-value pairs that specifies which tags (keys and values) are associated with the classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.DescribeClassificationJobResponse.UserPausedDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserPausedDetails.
If the current status of the job is USER_PAUSED, specifies when the job was paused and when the job or job run will expire and be cancelled if it isn't resumed. This value is present only if the value for jobStatus is USER_PAUSED.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Archived
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Archived.
Specifies whether the finding is archived (suppressed).

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Category
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Category.
The category of the finding. Possible values are: CLASSIFICATION, for a sensitive data finding; and, POLICY, for a policy finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.ClassificationDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClassificationDetails.
The details of a sensitive data finding. This value is null for a policy finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Count
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Count.
The total number of occurrences of the finding. For sensitive data findings, this value is always 1. All sensitive data findings are considered new (unique) because they derive from individual classification jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the finding was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Id
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Id.
The unique identifier for the finding. This is a random string that Amazon Macie generates and assigns to a finding when it creates the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Partition
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Partition.
The Amazon Web Services partition that Amazon Macie created the finding in.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.PolicyDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property PolicyDetails.
The details of a policy finding. This value is null for a sensitive data finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Region
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Region.
The Amazon Web Services Region that Amazon Macie created the finding in.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.ResourcesAffected
member.summary:

The resources that the finding applies to.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Sample
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Sample.
Specifies whether the finding is a sample finding. A sample finding is a finding that uses example data to demonstrate what a finding might contain.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.SchemaVersion
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SchemaVersion.
The version of the schema that was used to define the data structures in the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Severity
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Severity.
The severity level and score for the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Title
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Title.
The brief description of the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.Type
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Type.
The type of the finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.Finding.UpdatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UpdatedAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the finding was last updated. For sensitive data findings, this value is the same as the value for the createdAt property. All sensitive data findings are considered new (unique) because they derive from individual classification jobs.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.FindingAction
member.summary: Provides information about an action that occurred for a resource and produced a policy finding.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.FindingAction.ActionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ActionType.
The type of action that occurred for the affected resource. This value is typically AWS_API_CALL, which indicates that an entity invoked an API operation for the resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.FindingAction.ApiCallDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ApiCallDetails.
The invocation details of the API operation that an entity invoked for the affected resource, if the value for the actionType property is AWS_API_CALL.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.FindingActor

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.FindingActor.DomainDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DomainDetails.
The domain name of the device that the entity used to perform the action on the affected resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.FindingActor.IpAddressDetails

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.FindingStatisticsSortCriteria.OrderBy

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the GetBucketStatistics operation. Retrieves (queries) aggregated statistical data for all the S3 buckets that Amazon Macie monitors and analyzes.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsRequest.AccountId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property AccountId.
The unique identifier for the Amazon Web Services account.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the GetBucketStatistics operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.BucketCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketCount.
The total number of buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.BucketCountByEffectivePermission
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketCountByEffectivePermission.
The total number of buckets that are publicly accessible based on a combination of permissions settings for each bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.BucketCountByEncryptionType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketCountByEncryptionType.
The total number of buckets that use certain types of server-side encryption to encrypt new objects by default. This object also reports the total number of buckets that don't encrypt new objects by default.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.BucketCountByObjectEncryptionRequirement
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketCountByObjectEncryptionRequirement.
The total number of buckets whose bucket policies do or don't require server-side encryption of objects when objects are uploaded to the buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.BucketCountBySharedAccessType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketCountBySharedAccessType.
The total number of buckets that are or aren't shared with another Amazon Web Services account.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.ClassifiableObjectCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClassifiableObjectCount.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the buckets. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.ClassifiableSizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClassifiableSizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of all the objects that Amazon Macie can analyze in the buckets. These objects use a supported storage class and have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.
If versioning is enabled for any of the buckets, Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in those buckets. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of all applicable objects in the buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.LastUpdated
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastUpdated.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when Amazon Macie most recently retrieved both bucket and object metadata from Amazon S3 for the buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.ObjectCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ObjectCount.
The total number of objects in the buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.SizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the buckets.
If versioning is enabled for any of the buckets, Amazon Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each object in those buckets. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of the objects in the buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.SizeInBytesCompressed
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SizeInBytesCompressed.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that are compressed (.gz, .gzip, .zip) files in the buckets.
If versioning is enabled for any of the buckets, Amazon Macie calculates this value based on the size of the latest version of each applicable object in those buckets. This value doesn't reflect the storage size of all versions of the applicable objects in the buckets.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.UnclassifiableObjectCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnclassifiableObjectCount.
The total number of objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the buckets. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetBucketStatisticsResponse.UnclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UnclassifiableObjectSizeInBytes.
The total storage size, in bytes, of the objects that Amazon Macie can't analyze in the buckets. These objects don't use a supported storage class or don't have a file name extension for a supported file or storage format.

member.summary:

An array that lists specific character sequences (ignore words) to exclude from the results. If the text matched by the regular expression is the same as any string in this array, Amazon Macie ignores it. Ignore words are case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetCustomDataIdentifierResponse.Keywords
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Keywords.
An array that lists specific character sequences (keywords), one of which must be within proximity (maximumMatchDistance) of the regular expression to match. Keywords aren't case sensitive.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.GetCustomDataIdentifierResponse.MaximumMatchDistance
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MaximumMatchDistance.
The maximum number of characters that can exist between text that matches the regex pattern and the character sequences specified by the keywords array. Amazon Macie includes or excludes a result based on the proximity of a keyword to text that matches the regex pattern.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobDetails
member.summary: Specifies whether any one-time or recurring classification jobs are configured to analyze data in an S3 bucket, and, if so, the details of the job that ran most recently.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobDetails.IsDefinedInJob
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IsDefinedInJob.
Specifies whether any one-time or recurring jobs are configured to analyze data in the bucket. Possible values are:
TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more jobs and at least one of those jobs has a status other than CANCELLED. Or the bucket matched the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for at least one job that previously ran.
FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any jobs, all the jobs that explicitly include the bucket in their bucket definitions have a status of CANCELLED, or the bucket didn't match the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for any jobs that previously ran.
UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to retrieve job data for the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobDetails.IsMonitoredByJob
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property IsMonitoredByJob.
Specifies whether any recurring jobs are configured to analyze data in the bucket. Possible values are:
TRUE - The bucket is explicitly included in the bucket definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for one or more recurring jobs or the bucket matches the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for one or more recurring jobs. At least one of those jobs has a status other than CANCELLED.
FALSE - The bucket isn't explicitly included in the bucket definition (S3BucketDefinitionForJob) for any recurring jobs, the bucket doesn't match the bucket criteria (S3BucketCriteriaForJob) for any recurring jobs, or all the recurring jobs that are configured to analyze data in the bucket have a status of CANCELLED.
UNKNOWN - An exception occurred when Amazon Macie attempted to retrieve job data for the bucket.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobDetails.LastJobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastJobId.
The unique identifier for the job that ran most recently and is configured to analyze data in the bucket, either the latest run of a recurring job or the only run of a one-time job.
This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobDetails.LastJobRunTime
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastJobRunTime.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job (lastJobId) started. If the job is a recurring job, this value indicates when the most recent run started.
This value is typically null if the value for the isDefinedInJob property is FALSE or UNKNOWN.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScheduleFrequency
member.summary: Specifies the recurrence pattern for running a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScheduleFrequency.DailySchedule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DailySchedule.
Specifies a daily recurrence pattern for running the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScheduleFrequency.MonthlySchedule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MonthlySchedule.
Specifies a monthly recurrence pattern for running the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScheduleFrequency.WeeklySchedule
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property WeeklySchedule.
Specifies a weekly recurrence pattern for running the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScopeTerm
member.summary: Specifies a property- or tag-based condition that defines criteria for including or excluding S3 objects from a classification job. A JobScopeTerm object can contain only one simpleScopeTerm object or one tagScopeTerm object.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScopeTerm.SimpleScopeTerm
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SimpleScopeTerm.
A property-based condition that defines a property, operator, and one or more values for including or excluding objects from the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScopeTerm.TagScopeTerm
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TagScopeTerm.
A tag-based condition that defines the operator and tag keys or tag key and value pairs for including or excluding objects from the job.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScopingBlock
member.summary: Specifies one or more property- and tag-based conditions that define criteria for including or excluding S3 objects from a classification job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobScopingBlock.And
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property And.
An array of conditions, one for each property- or tag-based condition that determines which objects to include or exclude from the job. If you specify more than one condition, Amazon Macie uses AND logic to join the conditions.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary
member.summary: Provides information about a classification job, including the current status of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.BucketCriteria
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketCriteria.
The property- and tag-based conditions that determine which S3 buckets are included or excluded from the job's analysis. Each time the job runs, the job uses these criteria to determine which buckets to analyze. A job's definition can contain a bucketCriteria object or a bucketDefinitions array, not both.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.BucketDefinitions
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property BucketDefinitions.
An array of objects, one for each Amazon Web Services account that owns specific S3 buckets for the job to analyze. Each object specifies the account ID for an account and one or more buckets to analyze for that account. A job's definition can contain a bucketDefinitions array or a bucketCriteria object, not both.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.CreatedAt
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property CreatedAt.
The date and time, in UTC and extended ISO 8601 format, when the job was created.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The unique identifier for the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The current status of the job. Possible values are:
CANCELLED - You cancelled the job or, if it's a one-time job, you paused the job and didn't resume it within 30 days.
COMPLETE - For a one-time job, Amazon Macie finished processing the data specified for the job. This value doesn't apply to recurring jobs.
IDLE - For a recurring job, the previous scheduled run is complete and the next scheduled run is pending. This value doesn't apply to one-time jobs.
PAUSED - Macie started running the job but additional processing would exceed the monthly sensitive data discovery quota for your account or one or more member accounts that the job analyzes data for.
RUNNING - For a one-time job, the job is in progress. For a recurring job, a scheduled run is in progress.
USER_PAUSED - You paused the job. If you paused the job while it had a status of RUNNING and you don't resume it within 30 days of pausing it, the job or job run will expire and be cancelled, depending on the job's type. To check the expiration date, refer to the UserPausedDetails.jobExpiresAt property.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.JobType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobType.
The schedule for running the job. Possible values are:
ONE_TIME - The job runs only once.
SCHEDULED - The job runs on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.LastRunErrorStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property LastRunErrorStatus.
Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred when the job ran. For a recurring job, this value indicates the error status of the job's most recent run.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The custom name of the job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.JobSummary.UserPausedDetails
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property UserPausedDetails.
If the current status of the job is USER_PAUSED, specifies when the job was paused and when the job or job run will expire and be cancelled if it isn't resumed. This value is present only if the value for jobStatus is USER_PAUSED.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.KeyValuePair
member.summary: Provides information about the tags that are associated with an S3 bucket or object. Each tag consists of a required tag key and an associated tag value.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.KeyValuePair.Key
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Key.
One part of a key-value pair that comprises a tag. A tag key is a general label that acts as a category for more specific tag values.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.KeyValuePair.Value
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Value.
One part of a key-value pair that comprises a tag. A tag value acts as a descriptor for a tag key. A tag value can be an empty string.

member.name: T:Amazon.Macie2.Model.LastRunErrorStatus
member.summary: Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred when a classification job ran. For information about using logging data to investigate these errors, see Monitoring sensitive data discovery jobs in the Amazon Macie User Guide.

member.name: P:Amazon.Macie2.Model.LastRunErrorStatus.Code
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Code.
Specifies whether any account- or bucket-level access errors occurred when the job ran. For a recurring job, this value indicates the error status of the job's most recent run. Possible values are:
ERROR - One or more errors occurred. Amazon Macie didn't process all the data specified for the job.
NONE - No errors occurred. Macie processed all the data specified for the job.
